intro: Krynitzkia sericea, commonly known as the silky krynitzkia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silver-gray, silky foliage that gives it its common name, and it produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It is typically found in rocky, sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species. Krynitzkia sericea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
